answer.text:
Here's a simple summary based on scientific studies... [1]

Creatine supplementation is widely used...

Intermediate mode: Using more technical language.


This randomized trial examined the effects of daily creatine monohydrate supplementation on strength and muscle hypertrophy in resistance-trained men over 12 weeks... [1]

Creatine monohydrate has become a popular ergogenic aid due to its effects on strength and lean body mass. However, some concerns remain about potential long-term adverse effects... [2]

Concerns about kidney health remain a barrier to creatine use. This study monitored renal markers in resistance-trained adults supplementing with creatine for 12 months... [3]

references.citation: Garcia L, Thompson R (2020). Effects of creatine on strength and hypertrophy in trained men. Strength and Conditioning Research. DOI: 10.2345/creatine.strength.2020
Smith J, Lee K (2018). Long-term safety of creatine supplementation. Journal of Sports Nutrition. DOI: 10.1234/creatine.safe.2018
Brown D, Ahmed Z (2021). Renal function in resistance-trained individuals using creatine. Clinical Exercise Physiology. DOI: 10.5678/creatine.kidney.2021

Creatine monohydrate has become a popular ergogenic aid due to its effects on strength and lean body mass. However, some concerns remain about potential long-term adverse effects... [2]

As researchers investigating creatine supplementation, we have become increasingly
concerned about reports that government agencies are attempting to restrict the sale of
dietary supplements, including dietary supplements containing creatine, to children and
adolescents. Creatine is a naturally occurring compound found in every cell in the human... [3]
